author: Elvia Limon
description: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-Ark.) on Sunday said he doesn’t believe Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) should “pull back on any kind of enforcement” after the Trump administration directed the agency to pause raids against workers in the agriculture, hotel and restaurant industries. Cotton told CBS News’s Margaret Brennan on “Face The Nation” that “we need to have…
title: Cotton on Trump ICE pause on select industries: ‘I don’t think we should pull back on any kind of enforcement’

author: Clara Duhon
description: Sen. Rand Paul (R-Ky.) said he would be against censuring Sen. Alex Padilla after the California Democrat tried to approach and question Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem during a press conference, which led to federal agents forcibly removing and handcuffing him. “No, no, no. I’m not for censuring him. I think that’s crazy. I’m not for that at all,” Paul…
title: Paul ‘not for censuring’ Padilla: ‘I think that’s crazy’

author: Elvia Limon
description: Sen. Adam Schiff on Sunday called the handcuffing of fellow California Democratic Sen. Alex Padilla “atrocious” after Padilla was forcibly removed for interrupting Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s press conference in Los Angeles. “To see him mistreated that way and tackled to the ground and shackled that way and in the midst of what we’re seeing more broadly…
title: Schiff: Seeing Padilla ‘mistreated’ amid LA protests ‘just atrocious’

author: Tara Suter
description: President Trump said “it’s possible” the United States becomes involved in the current conflict between Iran and Israel, ABC News reported Sunday. “We’re not involved in it. It’s possible we could get involved. But we are not at this moment involved,” Trump told ABC News. ABC News also reported that Trump expressed interest in the…
title: Trump: ‘It’s possible’ US becomes involved in Israel-Iran conflict

author: Elvia Limon
description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) on Sunday remembered former Minnesota state Speaker Melissa Hortman (D) as “the most incredible person,” a day after Hortman and her husband, Mark, were fatally shot in what officials are calling a politically motivated shooting. “Melissa Hortman is the most incredible person, that I wish everyone in the nation knew her, went…
title: Klobuchar on slain Minnesota Democratic lawmaker: ‘The most incredible person’

author: Salman Al-Ansari, Opinion Contributor
description: Western governments are providing military, political, and economic support to Israel's current government, which is causing devastation in Gaza. Jewish communities in the West should be disturbed by this.
title: ‘Never again’ must also mean ‘Not in my name’

author: Lily Dallow
description: The crash, which officials declared a mass casualty incident, took place just as fans were leaving the CONCACAF Gold Cup match between Mexico and the Dominican Republic at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood.
title: Several injured after vehicle drives into crowd leaving soccer match: California officials

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Four candidates are vying for two vice chair spots on the Democratic National Committee (DNC) after a majority of members voted earlier this week to redo the election of David Hogg and Pennsylvania state Rep. Malcolm Kenyatta. Oklahoma DNC committee member Kalyn Free, who lost a bid for vice chair, filed a challenge in February…
title: Here are the 4 candidates running for DNC vice chair

author: Julie Marzouk, Opinion Contributor
description: The Department of Justice should act to uphold the integrity of its own programs by immediately withdrawing CAIR-California’s accreditation.
title: Trump’s DOJ should stop treating CAIR as a legitimate immigration provider

author: Tara Suter
description: Israel has claimed it hit an Iranian airport amid conflict between the two Middle East rivals. “The Israeli Air Force struck an Iranian aerial refueling aircraft at Mashhad Airport in eastern Iran, approximately 2,300 kilometers from Israel. This marks the longest-range strike conducted since the beginning of the operation,” Israel Defense Forces spokesperson Lt. Col.…
title: Israel claims it hit Iranian airport

author: Nathan Goodman, opinion contributor
description: The rest of us should ask a simple question: How would you feel if this power were used against you?
title: Border Patrol drones have shown up at the LA protests. Should we be worried?

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s moves to upend decades of vaccine policy could hit patients hardest in their wallets, as shifting guidance over shots could make insurance coverage confusing and scattershot.  For decades, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) independent advisory panel recommended which shots Americans should get and…
title: How Kennedy’s overhaul could make vaccines more expensive

author: Bernard Goldberg, opinion contributor
description: Here’s a free tip for the strategists: If you want to win back men, maybe start by telling your cultural allies to stop calling them bigots.
title: Some free commonsense advice for Democrats about winning back men

author: Rachel Scully
description: Israeli ambassador to the United States, Yechiel Leiter, said the goal in the war against Iran is not to contain it but to win it, as the two countries continue to exchange strikes for a third day. During an appearance on ABC’s “This Week,” host Martha Raddatz asked Leiter how Israel would avoid escalating and…
title: Israeli Ambassador: ‘Objective is not to contain the war’ but ‘win the war’ against Iran

author: Rabbi Mordechai Liebling and Pastor Julio Hernandez, opinion contributors
description: The idea of an immigrant registry in the United States — a system that tracks people based on their nationality or religion — is not only discriminatory, it is reminiscent of one of history’s darkest chapters: the Holocaust.
title: An immigrant registry is un-American — and alarmingly familiar

description: Minnesota state Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband were assassinated at their home on Saturday, and lawmakers from across the aisle have condemned the act of political violence. Both Democrats and Republicans, have also been critical of Trump’s massive military parade in Washington, D.C., which could cost up to $45 million. On Saturday, the “No…
title: Live updates: Lawmakers discuss Minnesota lawmakers fatal shooting, Israel-Iran conflict

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: The shockwaves generated by the tit-for-tat insults and threats still reverberate through NASA and the commercial space sector.
title: After the Trump-Musk dustup, NASA has much to consider

author: Rachel Scully
description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) said the deadly shooting of state Speaker Emerita Melissa Hortman (D) and her husband on Saturday was politically motivated, noting that there was some “throughline with abortion” after his list of targets was found to include abortion advocates and facilities. “Clearly, this is politically motivated,” she told NBC’s “Meet The Press” host…
title: Klobuchar on Minnesota shooter’s motivation: There’s ‘some throughline with abortion’

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: A white-collar bloodbath is coming. Not in theory. Not in ten years. It’s already begun.
title: Trump must stop the AI bloodbath before it’s too late

author: Filip Timotija
description: Iran and Israel have exchanged ballistic missiles and drone strikes in the latest escalation between the two longtime foes, continuing attacks as the international community hopes for the situation to de-escalate.  In its barrage of strikes on Saturday, the Israeli military reportedly targeted Iran’s major energy facilities and Tehran’s expanding nuclear program.  The Israeli Defense…
title: Iran, Israel exchange missiles, drone strikes in latest escalation

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The nation’s capital on Saturday was overtaken by the sight of tanks rolling down the street and Army helicopters buzzing in the sky for a military parade to mark the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army. The much-talked about event, which also fell on President Trump’s 79th birthday, featured military vehicles and members of the…
title: 5 takeaways from Trump’s Army parade

author: Lily Dallow
description: Officers deployed flashbangs and tear gas, and Sky5 captured the moment officers on foot and horseback moved into the large crowd.
title: Officers deploy tear gas, rubber bullets to clear protesters in downtown L.A.

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Saturday touted the might of the U.S. Army at the end of a two-hour parade to mark the 250th anniversary of the branch, framing it as a celebration of the country’s military successes. “Every other country celebrates their victories. It’s about time America did, too,” Trump said in prepared remarks. “That’s what…
title: Trump says it’s ‘about time’ US celebrates victories at military parade

author: Filip Timotija
description: Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) said that President Trump’s military parade in Washington, D.C., commemorating the 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army, is comprised of the “best of us” and that it should be celebrated regardless of where one might stand on the political spectrum.  “This parade is comprised of our sons, daughters, mothers and fathers—the…
title: Fetterman: Military parade comprised of ‘the verbest of us’
